tournament.name: ANZ Super Series Cycle 10 Regional Championships - Melbourne

decks.notes: This deck focuses on generating a large amount of red mana quickly through spells like Desperate Ritual and Ruby Medallion to cast a high number of spells in a single turn. The goal is to chain together spells and generate mana through rituals in order to storm off and win the game with a massive Grapeshot or other combo finisher. The deck also includes cards like Ral, Monsoon Mage and Glimpse the Impossible to help dig for key pieces and ensure the combo can be assembled quickly and efficiently.

This deck aims to quickly reanimate powerful creatures like Griselbrand using cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate. It also includes disruptive elements like Force of Negation and Thoughtseize to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent. Quantum Riddler and Psychic Frog provide additional value by filtering your draws and disrupting the opponent's game plan. The land base is designed to provide the necessary colors for the combo while also including utility lands like Meticulous Archive and Undercity Sewers. Overall, the deck focuses on combining powerful reanimation with disruptive elements to control the game.

The main concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast and aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Ocelot Pride, supported by cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Seasoned Pyromancer to maintain pressure on the board. The deck also includes powerful finishers like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Voice of Victory. Additionally, disruptive spells like Blood Moon and Goblin Bombardment are included to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the aggressive nature of the deck while also providing some flexibility in casting spells.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly deal damage to the opponent through a combination of aggressive creatures like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Monastery Swiftspear, along with burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Mutagenic Growth. The deck aims to maintain a steady flow of spells using cards like Mishra's Bauble and Expressive Iteration to keep up the pressure on the opponent. The land base is centered around enabling the deck's color requirements while providing flexibility for fetching needed lands. Overall, the deck focuses on fast, efficient aggression to overwhelm the opponent.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and efficient removal spells. The deck aims to establish a strong board presence early on with cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Ocelot Pride, while using cards like Galvanic Discharge and Thraben Charm to control the board and protect its creatures. Additionally, the deck has some disruptive elements like Blood Moon and Static Prison to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The inclusion of cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Voice of Victory provide additional support and pump up the creatures to finish the game quickly.

The deck focuses on generating value through sacrificing creatures and utilizing +1/+1 counters. By using cards like Basking Broodscale and Walking Ballista in combination with Malevolent Rumble and Blade of the Bloodchief, the deck aims to create a powerful board presence while disrupting the opponent's strategy. Cards like Urza's Saga and Agatha's Soul Cauldron help to generate additional resources and card advantage. The inclusion of Yawgmoth, Thran Physician provides a strong combo potential with the deck's creature base. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with an aggressive combo strategy.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a combination of cheap creatures and artifacts, supported by control elements like Engineered Explosives and Metallic Rebuke. Urza's Saga is used to tutor for important artifacts, while Thoughtcast provides card advantage. The inclusion of Tormod's Crypt and Shadowspear helps disrupt the opponent's graveyard or equipment strategy. The deck aims to establish a strong board presence and control the game through a mix of aggression and disruption, utilizing the synergy of artifacts and creatures to outpace the opponent.

The deck focuses on utilizing artifacts to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a combination of cheap creatures and powerful equipment. By leveraging cards like Mox Opal and Mishra's Bauble for mana acceleration, while using Urza's Saga to tutor for key artifacts, the deck aims to create a fast and aggressive board presence. With a mix of disruptive spells like Metallic Rebuke and Sink into Stupor, alongside powerful card draw in Thoughtcast, the deck looks to maintain tempo and pressure throughout the game.

The main idea of this deck is to utilize aggressive creatures and powerful spells to quickly overwhelm and defeat the opponent. By combining efficient creatures like Doorkeeper Thrull and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury with strong removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Leyline Binding, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early and maintain control of the battlefield. The inclusion of cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Consign to Memory provide additional versatility and disruption, while Leyline of the Guildpact helps to maximize the deck's potential by supporting multicolored creatures.

The main concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a mix of aggressive creatures and burn spells. The deck aims to establish board presence early with efficient creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Ocelot Pride, while also utilizing powerful enchantments like Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Static Prison to control the battlefield. The inclusion of cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Galvanic Discharge provide additional reach and removal options, making this deck a versatile and aggressive force to be reckoned with in the Modern format.

The deck revolves around quickly getting Atraxa onto the battlefield while using instant reanimate spells like Goryo's Vengeance and Faithful Mending to bring back powerful creatures like Griselbrand. By using cards like Ephemerate and Quantum Riddler, the deck aims to protect its key pieces while disrupting the opponent's game plan with counterspells like Force of Negation. The deck also includes removal spells like Prismatic Ending and disruption like Thoughtseize to control the board and pave the way for its combo pieces to take over the game.

The deck focuses on combining aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phage, Titan of Fire's Fury with disruptive spells like Teferi, Time Raveler and Prismatic Ending to control the board and pressure the opponent. With a mix of removal, card advantage, and powerful threats, the deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent and close out the game before they can stabilize. The various lands provide color fixing and utility to ensure the deck can cast its spells consistently and efficiently.

The deck utilizes a combination of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells to control the game and keep the opponent on the back foot. It aims to quickly build a board presence with efficient threats like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan through cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Prismatic Ending. Consign to Memory and Wrath of the Skies provide additional removal and card advantage, giving the deck flexibility in how it approaches each game. Overall, the deck's strategy revolves around punishing the opponent's actions and overwhelming them with tempo and pressure.

This deck focuses on disrupting your opponent's game plan while maintaining a steady pressure with aggressive creatures like Phliae, Exuberant Shepherd and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer. Cards like Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Consign to Memory help control the board and deal with threats efficiently. Teferi, Time Raveler and Quantum Riddler provide additional disruption and tempo advantage. The deck utilizes a mix of efficient removal and powerful creatures to put pressure on the opponent and grind out wins through attrition.

This deck focuses on utilizing powerful combo pieces like Fallaji Archaeologist and Thundertrap Trainer to create a win condition without relying on lands. By using a combination of cards like Disrupting Shoal, Flare of Denial, and Whir of Invention, the deck aims to disrupt opponent's strategies while assembling its own combo pieces. With control elements like Stern Scolding and Force of Negation, the deck can protect its key pieces while generating card advantage with cards like Sea Gate Restoration and Waterlogged Teachings. Overall, the deck aims to create a powerful combination of cards to win the game without traditional land-based strategies.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly build a board presence with cheap artifacts and disruptive instants, while utilizing Urza's Saga to create powerful tokens. Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provide card advantage and recursion, while Kappa Cannoneer and Pinnacle Emissary serve as aggressive threats. The deck also includes disruption elements like Engineered Explosives and Tormod's Crypt to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells in a fast-paced game.
